I appreciate what you're trying to do‚Äîespecially your idea of creating apps that don't have network access by default (as many do now, even those you wouldn't imagine would need it). Sadly, your clock lacks the simple feature I hoped it'd have: a volume control. Inexplicably, Android considers alarms "Media", not "Notifications"‚Äîso there's just one volume for music to help you fall asleep, and alarms to wake you. It's an oversight in the OS, not your fault. Thanks anyway!

google_play_reviews.content: Good multi-function app, but would be better with a few small additions: TTS voice output at customizable intervals stating time elapsed/remaining, timer options for ascending volume and mini-alert at customizable time (e.g. 1 minute remaining), speech input for timer, and ability to create, name, & choose timer presets. Also, timer should update to new duration when changed, not when started. It also seems odd that tapping on timer time resets it instead of showing time selection dialog.

Does exactly as it was designed to do. The widget responds to every size appropriately, by adding a new line or enlarging the text to ensure nothing is cut off but filling as much as possible. No need to re-add widgets to change colors either, because the options open right up to whatever HTML color code desires. Another stupidly simple app that's just plain old no nonsense simplicity. Some people rant about FOSS, but really KISS is the philosophy that takes precedence. Well done. ;)

The app runs fast, is customizable and doesn't turn your phone on when an alarm time comes... That's where the good things end here. If your phone is off and the alarm time passes, the next day if the phone is on but you haven't opened the app and turned the alarm off and on again, it won't go off... If you have a timer on, and turn off the screen then the timer will pause and not run. The stopwatch will do the same. I'm a bit disappointed because this app was supposed to be so good, and my experience has been quite poor at best.
Nice and simple. It doesn't do much more than the stock clock on my phone, and both don't have adds, so for me there's no point in allocating storage for two very similar clock apps

The concept of the Simple apps suite is quite awesome honestly, open 
source, easy to use, not tied to Google or any other cloud services, just 
basic, functional, and lightly customizable system apps. That being said, 
something needs to be fixed with this clock app, as it has failed to alert 
me when a timer was completed and when the time came for my morning alarm. 
Luckily, neither instances were critical events, so no harm done. I've gone 
to battery optimization and made sure this clock app was not being 
optimized, but I'm at a loss, is there a setting that I missed?

Would love to use it, looks cool, but the app crashes just a few seconds 
after opening it and disappears from my installed apps until I uninstall 
then reinstall via the app store again. I'm using a HTC 11 ultra phone btw.

The app has a lot of potential. I love that it's open source. Maybe some 
day I'll try contributing come code. Timer doesn't seem to continue 
counting down when you lock your phone. If alarms don't work when you first 
install it, try rebooting your phone. Would also be super handy if there 
were a notification that popped up an hour before the alarm, so you could 
dismiss it ahead of time.
